description.narrative: The Philippines Social Protection initiative supports the Philippine Government's social protection reform agenda. The activities relate to strengthening the capacity of the implementing agency (the Department of Social Welfare and Development) and the design, management and implementation mechanisms of the Philippines Conditional Cash Transfer (CCT) Program and the National Household Targeting System for Poverty Reduction (Pantawid Pamilyang Phipino Program). The activities also address education supply-side requirements of the CCT program. The program supports four major activities: World Bank Social Protection Programmatic AAA; Department of Social Welfare and Development Technical Assistance Facility for Social Protection; UNICEF Early Learning for Life; and DSWD Improving Access to Early Learning through Community-led approach. The total value of this initiative is $27.8 million over 9 years, starting 2008-09.
